content.user_title: Manage Medical Device Risk with ISO 14971 Expertise
content.value_statement: Medical device companies must implement comprehensive risk management throughout product lifecycle to meet regulatory requirements. This skill provides expert guidance on ISO 14971 implementation covering risk analysis, evaluation, control, and post-production monitoring.
actual_capabilities: Implement ISO 14971 risk management processes throughout product lifecycle
Conduct hazard identification and risk analysis for medical devices
Develop and verify risk control measures using hierarchy of controls
Integrate software risk management with IEC 62304 lifecycle processes
Manage cybersecurity risks for connected medical devices
Maintain risk management files for regulatory compliance
limitations: Does not replace formal risk management training or certification
Does not generate formal risk management documents or templates
Does not access external regulatory databases or update registries
Does not perform actual risk calculations or statistical analysis

use_cases.title: Conduct device risk assessments
use_cases.description: Perform hazard identification and risk estimation for new medical devices under development

use_cases.title: Prepare compliance documentation
use_cases.description: Create risk management documentation for FDA 510(k) and EU MDR technical submissions

use_cases.title: Implement software safety
use_cases.description: Integrate risk management with IEC 62304 software development lifecycle processes

prompt_templates.title: Create risk management plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a risk management plan for a new Class II medical device. Include risk management objectives, scope, acceptability criteria, and team responsibilities.

prompt_templates.title: Identify device hazards
prompt_templates.prompt: What hazards and hazardous situations should I consider for an infusion pump? Include mechanical, electrical, software, and use-related hazards.

prompt_templates.title: Design risk controls
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend risk control measures for a high-priority hazard in a connected glucose monitor. Apply the hierarchy of risk controls and suggest verification approaches.

prompt_templates.title: Integrate with QMS
prompt_templates.prompt: How should I integrate ISO 14971 risk management with our ISO 13485 quality management system? Include design controls, CAPA, and post-market surveillance integration points.

output_examples.input: What are the key hazards for an implantable cardiac monitor?
output: Electrical hazards: grounding issues, electromagnetic interference from external devices
Mechanical hazards: device migration, physical damage to surrounding tissue
Software hazards: data corruption, failure to alert, incorrect data processing
Biocompatibility hazards: material reactions, leaching of components
Cybersecurity hazards: unauthorized access, data breach, device manipulation
Use-related hazards: improper implantation, failure to monitor alerts

best_practices: Apply the hierarchy of risk controls: inherent safety by design first, then protective measures, then information for safety
Document all risk decisions including justification for acceptable risks and rationale for control measures
Integrate risk management early in design and maintain throughout the product lifecycle
anti_patterns: Relying solely on labeling and warnings instead of implementing inherent safety by design
Failing to consider reasonably foreseeable misuse during hazard identification
Completing risk analysis as a one-time activity instead of maintaining throughout lifecycle

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides guidance applicable to any AI assistant.

faq.question: Does this skill generate formal risk management files?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance and frameworks. You must create formal documents using your organization's templates.

faq.question: What regulatory frameworks does this cover?
faq.answer: Primary focus is ISO 14971. Also addresses FDA guidance, EU MDR requirements, and IEC 62304 software integration.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution. No data is sent to external servers or stored anywhere.

faq.question: Can this skill replace risk management training?
faq.answer: No. This skill supplements but does not replace formal training. Users should have ISO 14971 foundational knowledge.

faq.question: How does this compare to commercial risk management software?
faq.answer: This skill provides expert guidance. Commercial tools automate calculations and document generation. Use both together for comprehensive coverage.
